thread.title: One dead after vehicle and milk tanker crash on SH1 in South Canterbury
thread.title_full: One dead after vehicle and milk tanker crash on SH1 in South Canterbury

title: One dead after vehicle and milk tanker crash on SH1 in South Canterbury
text:
One dead after vehicle and milk tanker crash on SH1 in South Canterbury Last updated 11:36, February 17 2017 BEN AULAKH/ FAIRFAX NZ 
A milk tanker lies on its side after a fatal crash with another vehicle near Glenavy. 
One person is dead after a crash on State Highway 1 near Glenavy, 20 kilometres north of Oamaru. 
Senior Sergeant Roy Apperly said a vehicle and milk tanker collided about 9.45am on Friday at Whitneys Creek. 
A St John spokesman said one person died at the scene and another, who was initially reported as seriously injured, was assessed but required no further medical attention. BEN AULAKH/FAIRFAX NZ 
A police officer directs traffic onto a diversion after a fatal crash in South Canterbury. 
The police serious crash unit and other emergency services were in attendance and would be on the scene for some time. 
SH1 is closed south of Waimate, near Carrolls Rd, he said. 
Christchurch Transport Operations Centre adviser Luke Thomas said traffic was being diverted down Old Ferry Rd and Glenavy-Tawai Rd. BEN AULAKH/FAIRFAX NZ 
Emergency service personnel are at a fatal crash on State Highway 1 in South Canterbury. 
A police communications spokeswoman said the highway was expected to be closed until mid-to-late afternoon while the crash was being investigated. 
Fire communications shift manager Brent Dunn said Glenavy and Waimate fire crews were called out to the crash just before 10am. 
"We are currently dealing with a milk tanker versus car," he said. BEN AULAKH/FAIRFAX NZ 
An ambulance heads away from the scene of a fatal crash on State Highway 1 in South Canterbury. 
The crash was significant, he said. Ad Feedback 
Drivers were asked to follow the requests of emergency services. 
Otago Helicopters chief pilot Graeme Gale said they responded straight away but were stood down on the way. 
More to come
